casebody.data:
CONSOLIDATED HOME EQUIPMENT CORPORATION v. STATE ACCIDENT FUND et al. [No. 17,

April Term, 1940.]

Decided May 22nd, 1490.

The cause was reargued before BOND, C. J., Offutt, Parke, Sloan, Mitchell, Shehan, Johnson, and Delaplaine, JJ.

Jacob Kartman and Leo M. Alpert, with whom were Makover & Kartman on the brief, for the appellant. J. Edgar Harvey, Special Attorney for the State Accident Fund, with whom were William C. Walsh, Attorney General, and William L. Henderson, Deputy Attorney General on the brief, for the State Accident Fund, appellee. *680Robert E. Coughlan, Jr., with whom was Timothy J. Hughes on the brief, for the Maryland Casualty Company, appellee. Bond, C. J.,

delivered the opinion of the Court.
